description: Dashboard providing real-time observability for the Rust REST API server. It tracks performance, resource usage, request throughput, error rates, and system health metrics to support monitoring, troubleshooting, and capacity planning.

panels.description: Total number of requests made to the server within the range configured in the panel.

targets.legendFormat: Total number of requests made to the server

panels.title: Total Request

panels.description: Number of successful requests to the server within the range configured in the panel.
panels.title: Success

panels.description: Number of failed server requests within the range configured in the panel.
panels.title: Error

panels.description:
Average response time of a request.
Measures the mean duration a request takes to be processed, helping assess overall API performance and latency.
panels.title: Avarege Response Time Seconds (RTS)

panels.description:
Average response time of a request.
Measures the mean duration a request takes to be processed, helping assess overall API performance and latency.
panels.title: Request per seconds (RPS)

panels.description: Displays the response rate grouped by HTTP status codes, helping identify performance patterns and error spikes.
panels.title: Response Status Rate

panels.description: This panel displays the percentage of total system memory currently in use, providing a clear view of overall memory consumption and helping to identify potential resource constraints or memory pressure.
panels.title: System Memory Usage (%)

panels.description: This panel displays the total system memory currently in use in bytes, providing a clear view of overall memory consumption and helping to identify potential resource constraints or memory pressure.
panels.title: System Memory Usage in Bytes

panels.description: Displays the resident memory (RSS) used by the Rust service, showing how much physical RAM the process is currently occupying. Useful for tracking memory growth, spotting leaks, and monitoring overall resource usage.
panels.title: Server Resident Memory (RSS)

panels.description: Tracks the amount of virtual memory allocated by the Rust application, including memory reserved but not necessarily used. Useful for identifying memory growth, fragmentation, or abnormal allocation patterns.
panels.title: Server Virtual Memory

panels.description: Displays the total number of CPU cores available on the host system, indicating the processing capacity that can be used by the application and the operating system.
panels.title: CPU Core Count

panels.description: Shows the percentage of CPU currently in use, representing how much of the available processing capacity is being consumed over time.
panels.title: Global CPU Usage (%)

panels.description: Displays the CPU time (user and system) used by the process on which the Server is running in seconds.
panels.title: Process CPU Time

panels.description: Shows the percentage of CPU currently in use all cores (global), representing how much of the available processing capacity is being consumed over time.
panels.title: Global CPU Usage (%)

panels.description: Shows the percentage of CPU currently in use per core, representing how much of the available processing capacity is being consumed over time.
panels.title: CPU Usage per Core (%)

panels.description: Timestamp indicating when the process started, represented as seconds since the Unix epoch.
panels.title: Server Uptime

panels.description: Represents the number of active threads used by the server, helping monitor concurrency levels and detect overload or thread-related bottlenecks.
panels.title: Server Thread Count

panels.description: Number of file descriptors currently opened by the process. This metric helps monitor resource usage and detect potential file descriptor leaks, high I/O load, or limits being approached on the operating system.
panels.title: Number of Open File Descriptors

panels.description: Percentage of the number of file descriptors currently opened by the process. This metric helps monitor resource usage and detect potential file descriptor leaks, high I/O load, or limits being approached on the operating system.
panels.title: File Descriptors Usage

panels.description: This panel displays the amount of data received across the available network interfaces. It helps monitor network throughput, identify traffic patterns, and detect potential bottlenecks or abnormal network usage in real time.
panels.title: Received Bytes

panels.description: This panel displays the amount of data transmitted across the available network interfaces. It helps monitor network throughput, identify traffic patterns, and detect potential bottlenecks or abnormal network usage in real time.
panels.title: Transmitted Bytes

title: Rust Rest API
